Travel the universe: With the ability to live forever, I would explore every corner of the universe. I would visit distant planets, moons, and asteroids, discovering new life forms and civilizations. I would witness the birth and death of stars, and witness the evolution of the universe firsthand. Confidence score: 0.9

Learn every subject: I would devote myself to learning every subject imaginable, from the most basic to the most complex. I would delve into the mysteries of quantum mechanics, the secrets of the human brain, and the nature of time itself. I would become an expert in every field of study, and I would never stop learning. Confidence score: 0.8

Create art and music: With an eternity at my disposal, I would dedicate myself to creating the most beautiful and meaningful art and music the world has ever known. I would paint, sculpt, write poetry, compose music, and dance, pushing the boundaries of creativity and expression. My works would be timeless, and they would inspire generations to come. Confidence score: 0.9

Solve world problems: I would use my eternal life to solve some of the world's most pressing problems, such as poverty, hunger, and disease. I would work tirelessly to find sustainable solutions, using my knowledge and resources to make a real difference in the lives of millions. I would also work to preserve the planet and protect it from harm. Confidence score: 0.8

Explore the depths of the ocean: With an eternity at my disposal, I would delve into the depths of the ocean, discovering new species, exploring underwater cities, and uncovering the secrets of the sea. I would explore the coral reefs, the darkest parts of the ocean, and the ocean's floor, uncovering the mysteries of the ocean's depths. Confidence score: 0.9
